questions.text: Which of the following best describes the quantity of a commodity purchased by an individual, family, or group of people at different prices at a given time and place?
Which of the following best describes the term 'demand' in economics?
options: The quantity of a commodity a consumer wants.
The quantity of a commodity a consumer is willing and able to buy at a given price over a period of time.
The ability to pay for a commodity.

questions.text: According to the Law of Demand, what is the nature of the relationship between the price of a product and the quantity demanded?

In economic analysis, the phrase "ceteris paribus" is often used when stating the Law of Demand. What does this term mean?
options: Prices are flexible in the long run

questions.text: Which of the following is considered the most important determinant of demand in the short run?
According to the Law of Demand, if the price of a luxury watch increases from $5,000 to $7,000, what is the most likely effect on the quantity demanded?
options: It will shift the demand curve to the right

Which of the following statements is correct regarding the "Income Effect" for different types of goods?
options: It is always positive for all goods.
It is negative for normal goods.
It is negative for inferior goods.
It has no effect on luxury goods.
